channel.title: Project Portfolio on Jonathan Okeke
channel.description: Recent content in Project Portfolio on Jonathan Okeke

item.title: I: An Autonomous Waste-Sorting Robot
item.description: Link to project demo on Youtube PROJECT SUMMARY I designed and built an automated waste sorting system that comprised of a robotic manipulator, powered by an intelligent vision system that leveraged a convolutional neural network to perform the real-time waste classification. SKILLS & TECHNOLOGIES UTILIZED • Python • TensorFlow • OpenCV • Inverse Kinematic Modelling. The Robot Body • Consisted of a 3-D printed 4DOF robotic arm.

item.title: II: Pre-Owned Vehicle Sale Price Predictor
item.description: Link to web project Link to GitHub repo Project Summary A web-based tool that any sedan vehicle owner can use to get an estimate of what their vehicle would be worth based on various factors. The service uses a trained XGBoost linear regression model, trained on historical vehicle data obtained from Kaggle, to make a vehicle sale price estimate. The model was wrapped as a Flask Web Application and deployed to the internet using Heroku.

item.title: III: Hydrogen Vehicle Prototype Construction
item.description: Project Gallery Project Summary As part of the annual Shell-Eco Marathon Competition, me and three other teammates designed and built a one-man hydrogen fuel cell prototype vehicle. With this vehicle, we set a new African Shell-Eco Marathon vehicle efficiency record which puts as in first place and qualified our team for the global finalist competition that year. Team Responsibilities As part of the team I worked on :-

item.title: IV: Path Planning Visualizer
item.description: Link to Youtube Demo Link to GitHub repo Project Summary A path planning visualization that implements the A* path planning algorithm. Description The A*star path planning algorithm is a popular and efficient graph traversal and search algorithm that was developed in 1968 by Peter Hart, Nils Nilsson and Bertram Raphael of the Stanford Research Institute. I have always been fascinated by the efficiency and complexity of search algorithms and this interest led me to try and implement the algorithm myself in an interesting and visual way.
